page.title: 11TOURISM YARMOUTH LIFEBOATS
page.content: 1924-36{"BASP"}46ft. Watson type with 80 h.p. petrol engine,speed 8 knots - saved 30 lives. 1936-64{"S.G.E."}46ft. twin diesel.The first boat with a radio telephone - saved 164 lives. 1964-1977{"EARL AND COUNTESS HOWE" 48ft.,self-righting and with radar,VHF and UHF radio - speed 9 knots - saved 92 lives 1977- today{"JOY AND JOHN WADE"}52ft. twin 460h.p.caterpillar diesel, speed 18 knots. This speed enables her to cover the Solent area and a large area of the Channel nearly to the French coast. She has saved 20 lives so far and has a crew of 7 and can carry 160 survivors in fine weather and 31 in rough weather. Her range is 240 miles at full speed. Lifeboats at Yarmouth have been responsible for the saving of 523 lives over the last 60 years.
